info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 4:06PM EDT until August 22 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
FFWCHS
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Colleton County in southeastern South Carolina... Hampton County in southeastern South Carolina...
* Until 700 PM EDT.
* At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Bells Crossroads to Canadys. This activity will drift south into Walterboro. As much as 2 to 3 inches of rain has fallen over this area today. An additional 2 to 4 inches could fall through 7 PM, resulting in flash flooding. People living and working along Ireland Creek in Walterboro should carefully monitor water levels this afternoon into tonight. Be ready to take action should levels in creek reach flood stage.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton, Cottageville, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Ruffin, Canadys, Round O and Padgetts.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
